channel.title: Beer pong fight ends in fatal shooting
channel.description:
BRIDGEPORT, Pa. - One man is dead and another in jail after what police say was an argument over a drinking game that escalated into a fatal shooting. Investigators in suburban Philadelphia say 24-year-old Joseph Jimenez shot and killed 25-year-old Scott Riley after they started arguing over a game of beer pong at a party Friday night in Bridgeport, about 15 miles outside Philadelphia. Authorities say the two men began arguing during the party and then met up outside, where Riley mocked Jimenez and challenged him to shoot. According to a police complaint, Jimenez drew a concealed .40-caliber handgun and fired, striking Riley in the neck. Riley was taken to a hospital, where he died. Jimenez is being held without bail on first- and third-degree murder charges.
sauce: http://www.azcentral.com/offbeat/articles/2009/05/05/20090505beerpong.html What a waste of someone's life..

item.title: Beer pong fight ends in fatal shooting
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:18, topic:277790”][quote author=yakman link=topic=366707.msg2800402#msg2800402 date=1243354034]
I suppose pro-gun people will be saying we should give out more guns to stop this kind of thing.

time to drop the second amendment methinks?
[/quote]
I disagree. Having been mugged, I believe I would have been better off if I had a gun. The reality is that the people who mugged me could have easily had knives, despite the fact that it’s illegal to carry knives, and potentially guns.
Obviously outlaws have the upper hand because they don’t abide by these laws.

If I had a weapon, I could have at least shot one of them. But hey, that’s what I get for abiding by the law in Australia - loss of property, and police arriving no less than 20 minutes later making it impossible for them to catch the perpetrators.[/quote]

It’s funny! But wow you got mugged? HOW!! WHY??

Read full topic
item.source: Beer pong fight ends in fatal shooting

I disagree. Having been mugged, I believe I would have been better off if I had a gun. The reality is that the people who mugged me could have easily had knives, despite the fact that it’s illegal to carry knives, and potentially guns.
Obviously outlaws have the upper hand because they don’t abide by these laws.

If I had a weapon, I could have at least shot one of them. But hey, that’s what I get for abiding by the law in Australia - loss of property, and police arriving no less than 20 minutes later making it impossible for them to catch the perpetrators.[/quote]
If I know every one had a gun, I would shoot you before robbing you. But without legalizing of gun I could rob you without fear for being shoot and the would not get much damage.

So that can be an other consequence for everybody have a gun on the street.

item.title: Beer pong fight ends in fatal shooting
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

haticks:

In west Philadelphia born and raised…

…On the playground where I spent most of my days
Chilling out, maxing, relaxing all cool
And all shooting some b-ball outside of the school
When a couple of guys said were up in no good
Started making trouble in my neighbourhood
I got in one little fight and my mom got scared
And said youre moving with your aunte and uncle in bel-air

I begged and pleaded with her the other day
But she packed my suitcase and sent me on my way
She gave me a kissin and she gave me my ticket
I put my walkman on and said I might aswell kick it

First class, yo this is bad,
Drinking orange juice out of a champagne glass
Is this what the people of bel-air livin like,
Hmm this might be alright!

I whistled for a cab and when it came near the
Licensplate said fresh and had a dice in the mirror
If anything I could say that this cab was rare
But I thought now forget it, yo home to bel-air

I pulled up to a house about seven or eight
And I yelled to the cabby yo, home smell you later
Looked at my kingdom I was finally there
To settle my throne as the prince of bel-air

Sorry, just had to do that

[quote=“T4_, post:11, topic:277790”][quote author=Bebe link=topic=366707.msg2788647#msg2788647 date=1242608137]

[quote]BRIDGEPORT, Pa. - One man is dead and another in jail after what police say was an argument over a drinking game that escalated into a fatal shooting.

Investigators in suburban Philadelphia say 24-year-old Joseph Jimenez shot and killed 25-year-old Scott Riley after they started arguing over a game of beer pong at a party Friday night in Bridgeport, about 15 miles outside Philadelphia.

Authorities say the two men began arguing during the party and then met up outside, where Riley mocked Jimenez and challenged him to shoot.

According to a police complaint, Jimenez drew a concealed .40-caliber handgun and fired, striking Riley in the neck. Riley was taken to a hospital, where he died.

Jimenez is being held without bail on first- and third-degree murder charges.[/quote]
sauce: http://www.azcentral.com/offbeat/articles/2009/05/05/20090505beerpong.html

What a waste of someone’s life…

There’s your problem right there.

I live outside of Philadelphia and it’s turning into a hell hole. I just it heard on the news there are an average of 7 people killed a day.
[/quote]
Ironically, I was just in South Philadelphia the other day; didn’t seem too bad.

What is beer pong?

Wow.[/quote]Try New York, or Detroit; much worse than Philadelphia.

Read full topic
